conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway/isometric 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and an elevated angled viewpoint exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion, readable corners, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some wall tops/edges and openings (doors) reduces realism slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency broadly match (4 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, multiple toilets, deck/balcony). Some proportional/corridor/partition placements appear simplified, and not all openings align unambiguously with the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds in multiple rooms, living seating, dining table). Kitchen modeled with counters/island-like elements. Bathroom fixtures are present but simplified and not consistently detailed across all toilets.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and readable wall/floor separation. Lighting is neutral and does not obscure geometry. Materials are simple/consistent; some openings (doors) are ambiguous due to minimal door geometry.

detected_errors.description: Some layout fidelity issues: certain internal partitions/circulation widths and room proportions appear simplified versus the 2D plan.
Doors/openings are not consistently represented with clear door geometry (swings/leaves), making exact door placement verification weaker.
Bathroom/kitchen fixtures are partially simplified; not every wet area shows complete fixture detail corresponding to each labeled toilet in the 2D plan.
Minimal material/texture variation slightly reduces structural legibility of specific elements (e.g., differentiating some partitions and openings).

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with some simplified internal partitions and less-verifiable door/opening specifics.
